About us

We are The Enerchi Initiative

Enerchi Initiative is an social venture launched by Pythagoras Ecology and Calgary Community Developement. We are a collective of community figures, dedicated to being sustainable environmental practices and widening educational resource access through technology.

Our goal is to increase our harmony with our environment. In order to be in harmony people need to have a balanced relationship with technology, the environment, and the self. Through our work, we hope to be building toward this future in the projects we build with our local community. Since our founding, we have always focused on the importance of technological literacy and youth education.

We are launching a new arm of our initiative to bridge the digital divide. Because of COVID-19, Millions of students from low-income, and/or systematically disadvantaged groups are stuck at home without computers, internet, or a dedicated place where they can do their work. These students are falling behind, and Without intervention, these students are expected to lose a year of schooling. Our children need workspaces now! Invest in our children and invest in our future!

We are tackling a systematic issue, so we built a complex adaptive system.

We proposed to solve two problems at once: getting rid of the dead trees that cause wildfires, and building dignified workstations for the community. To mitigate the fact that many do not have a computer, we propose using N-computing to enable one computer to serve up to 6 students.

We are launching our pilot of the initiative in downtown Fresno. As our program expands and grows, we also hope to extend our reach to provide learning spaces for youth in disadvantaged or disaster-affected areas across the United States.

Furniture that speaks to our Inner Chi

Our beautiful furniture, designed by Gregg Fleishma, increase a student's self esteem by showing them they are worth having something beautiful. This is the power of â€œInner chi." Our furniture speaks to the inner chi of students by brining beauty and creativity into their lives so they can grow to love it and be inspired to create it.

Pilot Program

Our Pilot With Fresno

Fresno is the foothill of the Sierra and also the area of the greatest effect of the tinder. The forest near Fresno has been highly affected by mass tree death caused by drought and increase in the Pine Beetle population both caused by climate change.

Fresno has agreed to partner with us to supply desks to their students.

Key Organizational Partners

  • Southern California Edison: Provider of the raw materials utilized to create the Enerchi Tech Kits which provides community members with employment opportunities.
  • Calvary Community Development Organization: Community partner facilitating recidivism reduction skills and counseling services.
  • Reedley College and the State Center Community College District consortium: Collegiate partner for work-study opportunities for formerly incarcerated fellows and community based learning opportunities for traditional students. Provides access and opportunities for community participants to gain valuable skill in the forestry and robotics departments, thereby allowing non-traditional students access to vocational training, These relationships serve as a conduit for people outside of the college system to benefit from the skill acquisition and additional resources available in institutions of higher learning.
